intro: Schmaltzia ribifolia, commonly known as the redcurrant bush, is a deciduous shrub native to Europe and parts of Asia. Its flowers are greenish-yellow and appear in clusters, followed by the edible berries that are rich in vitamin C. Schmaltzia ribifolia is often cultivated for both ornamental and culinary purposes.
